p: Constitutive immunity was measured as described by Buehler and colleagues [28]. Briefly, the bacteria killing capacity of whole blood against E. coli and S. aureus was assessed by incubating diluted blood samples with E. coli suspension for 10 min, or with S. aureus suspension for 120 min at 41°C, and inoculating the mixtures onto agar plates in duplicate. Control plates were inoculated with E. coli or S. aureus suspension. The plates were incubated at 36°C overnight and the colonies were counted the next day. The proportion of killed microorganisms was calculated as the number of colonies on the test plates relative to the number of colonies on the control plates.
